channel.title: Packet Sniffer Hacking
channel.description:
Hey,
Ever notice how people get passwords and usernames very easily? Especially in onlinegames such as runescape and whatever else. Well, since RuneScape is cheap and they don't have a secure login on their website, their information is spewing out to anyone who wants to read it.
I tested this out on my dad's unix work computer using the Snoop Command which is supposed to be used for finding problems in networks, but you can also do it to websites. Websites such as Google Mail and Yahoo Mail now have secure logins by Verisign which encrpyts all the data coming out.
If you use a packet sniffer on www.runescape.com, you can see all the information coming out if you know how to use it. In unix, all you had to do was snoop a website and search for only 1 string. So have it running for several hours, and that person you're looking for decides to login to the website, and suddenly the packet sniffer will find that string, and locate all the other information coming off it.
This is really sad, cause almost any moron could do this and hack. Hacking isn't hard, it's just too easy. unless you wanted to hack a company lol (microsoft got hacked and lost its XP source code so idk lol).
Well this was just a fun little fact. I didn't hack ofcourse. But you can do that to these forums since these forums don't have a secure login either. :rolleyes:
Edit for Runescape.com [img]http://img138.imageshack.us/img138/8033/rsnoencryption3tg.jpg[/img]
~Ron

item.title: Packet Sniffer Hacking
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You can packet sniff hardware you’re interfaced to, as frank_ said. For example, I could sniff my network card and see MY rs password (encrypted) being sent out as I logged on, and the forum posts I posted and read. I’d also see my cookie being sent to the forum, which I could use to get MY password.

The reason you can also sniff your local LAN is because most home LANs are using cheap hubs which are just repeaters, everything that goes into the hub from one machine is broadcast to all of the other machines, and then the networking software looks at it and decides if it was aimed at your pc or another one. Using a sniffer’s driver instead of your normal network driver, you can just look at everything.

If the internet did this, it would all be very inefficient, slow and insecure, so it dosen’t, so you are most definately not getting other peoples passwords - I suggest you look at the data in your sniffer a lot more closely.

Read full topic

item.title: Packet Sniffer Hacking
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I agree, stealing accounts is wrong. I just wanted to let people know, even though their computers ‘may’ be safe, runescape probably isn’t. So if you get hacked, it may not always be a virus, it could be packet sniffing or something else.

But, since I did post this, I’m sure I did encourage others to do it too. I figured most people arleady knew, since it’s been going on since the internet first came out. It’s supposed to be used to find a computer in a network that is sending junk out, so people can fix the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Packet Sniffer Hacking
item.dc:creator: @Coolnoob55 Coolnoob55
item.description:
@Coolnoob55 wrote:

[quote=“Vipsta, post:31, topic:3853”]lolololollllolloll KTHXPASSWORDS?!?!

[size=20pt]ATTENTION FUCKTARD ALERT![/size]

Ron, you are a fucking retard muthafucking cunt face. You don’t need Linux to sniff packets. You can’t just goto a website a start sniffing you fucker dickweed. You need to have someone who plays RuneScape logged into your LAN (or you can login to their LAN) and you need to do whats called an ARP attack (Cain & Abel). Then you need to start Ethereal or Packetyzer and log packets. Then you need to go through the bazillions that are sent and figure out which ones have username/password.

[size=20pt]OHHHH FUCK WAIT A FUCKING SECOND YOU JEW[/size]

When you login to the forums/message centre/gay pr0n centre (P-Mod Centre)/ or the centre centre its all HTTPS! WHICH == ENCRYPTED! THATS SSL YOU POOPSTICK!

So you need to have Cain & Abel send out a fake sign thingy (not exactly sure how that part works) which will then make it look like its being encrypted, buts its actually being sent to you.

Basically, you ain’t done gettin no nigga’s passw0rd unless you live close to them and have half a brain. Stop spreading false hope amongst these gangsta’s.

Iigh sh0w, I’ma fly high nowz[/quote]

Screw you and go to hell.

Read full topic

item.title: Packet Sniffer Hacking
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

frank_:

Yes, if properly implemented on an unsecure auth system, it will work. However, you have to properly implement it to filter out all packets that you are not interested in, otherwise you will spend a lot of time searching the packet log.

Exactly what I have been saying! That is true. If you packet sniff some site and say you want some guys password and his name is 390812097. You would filter out everything except for 390812097, and when the packet gets a match, you can let it do whatever you like after that.

Or you will get all this random information lol. =D

Read full topic

item.title: Packet Sniffer Hacking
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Totally missing the point… The point is that packet sniffing works, and has been an old way of getting password and other information of websites for a long time.

Receiving random information from runescape such as forum posts, or from mopar’s site such as usernames and passwords (I haven’t tried it on here, but I checked with firefox, and it says this website isn’t encrypted), or any other website for that matter that doesn’t have encryption.

Read full topic
